tweets.text:
A lot of news out there...

But don't forget the weather...

Tell friends to follow us and @metoffice for updates... or these great accounts if you've family across England: @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyAnglia @EnvAgencyYNE @EnvAgencyNW @EnvAgencyMids and/or @EnvAgencySW 
#floodaware https://t.co/IaQXwjnoLe

Heavy & persistent rainfall has led to widespread surface water & river #flooding in parts of the #Midlands

tweets.text:
When cooking #ChristmasDinner, don‚Äôt pour fats, oils, grease and scraps down the sink as this can lead to a build-up of #fatbergs, causing blockages and pollution. 

Leave them to cool then scrape into the food waste or bin instead. 

Don‚Äôt feed a festive fatberg. https://t.co/mJx5p2fM9H

Rather oddly Gov's press release doesn't make a single mention of the local community group, @CleanIlkley who's idea this was and who's achievement this actually is.

Why would that be @pow_rebecca @EnvAgency @NFUtweets @YorksWildlife @YorkshireWater?

https://t.co/7tsiP8dU5w

Mixed emotions this morning. V lucky to have a #XmasEve the family. While sadly many 100‚Äôs of people in @EnvAgency, local councils, int drainage boards & emergency services responding today. Best wishes to all & anyone impacted. #floodaware #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/5Pu34jr2NO

Heavy rainfall falling across Barnstaple area, causing the River Yeo to rise. Flooding is possible from Collard Bridge to Barnstaple, including Snapper, the Fish Farm, Underwood Meadows and The Old Water Mill. Teams are out in the area clearing trash screens and monitoring.

Lots of reports of Internal Drainage Boards & @EnvAgency staff working hard at the moment to deal with yet more heavy rainfalls events. The vital work of @ADA_updates members is of critical importance to so many communities across the Country https://t.co/4oNVMyASvC

@DuncanWestbury @NaturalEngland @NEFieldUnit @EnvAgency @DaveThroupEA I have been recording on this site for 4 years, lots of arable annuals like Sharp-leaved Fulellen, Corn Spurrey, Small Toadflax etc. plus at least 4 singing male Skylarks.

urls.title: Parking Sites - Worcester City Council
urls.description: The City Council is the leading provider of parking services in Worcester City. We have fourteen car parks with over 2500 spaces, and three 'on street' controlled parking zones, for people living in, working in or just visiting the City of Worcester.

tweets.text: Don't forget that Pitchcroft car park is closed because flooding. Please park in St Martin's Gate or one of our other car parks https://t.co/6pwIIlDAb3 #Worcester #CarParking https://t.co/kqnIZG7EAs
@EnvAgencyMids More details on road closures in #Worcestershire can be found in this #thread ‚¨áÔ∏è https://t.co/A3PqRNtdNo

Many areas remain flooded, especially Alconbury, so drive with care üöó
Consider road closures, drive to the road conditions and don't drive through flood water.
Floodline: 0345 988 1188 üìû
Updates also via @cambsfrs @huntsdc @CambsCC @EnvAgencyAnglia  #CambsFlooding #SaferCambs https://t.co/Fkl2WrOYbh

With persistent heavy rain across the Midlands today & into tomorrow flooding is possible.

Temporary flood barriers are en route to #StratfordUponAvon in case they're needed. A decision will be made tomorrow am.

Keep up-to-date with the latest situation: https://t.co/pEGfsCeVzU https://t.co/mz97O4uUOx

Custodian of the landscape? The landowner cuts the fallow in late June  destroying skylark nests & ploughs in autumn leaving soil bare. #SoWrong @NaturalEngland @NEFieldUnit @EnvAgency @DaveThroupEA https://t.co/hU6qtZV93Y

I‚Äôm on duty from today as Field Operations Duty Officer for North & East Yorkshire - until the 30th. Handover and checks all complete including checking telemetry and our trash screen cameras. If your area is at risk of #flooding, remember that flood water can contain hidden dangers like lifted manhole covers and sharp objects.

Don‚Äôt walk through #floodwater, it‚Äôs not worth the risk.

Check your local flood risk: https://t.co/BpUpnjiX4L ‚ÄØ

#PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/JhiiSR3V8F

Heavy rain is expected across the south of England, parts of the Midlands, Lincolnshire and East Anglia on Wednesday and Thursday. This could lead to flooding.

Stay safe and don‚Äôt walk or drive through flood water.

Sign up to get warnings in England: https://t.co/P5d6Axp8Vq https://t.co/ForWYmQhK8

A Flood Alert has been issued by @EnvAgencySE for Lower River Medway. 

Flooding possible for: Hampstead Lock at Yalding to Allington Lock, including East Farleigh, Wateringbury, Teston and Teston Park, Tovil and Maidstone including Millennium Park.    

https://t.co/XjW8jKua77

@NorthamptonBC @EnvAgency @LockTask nervous this evening as we see the floodplain on Banbury Lane fill up. It‚Äôs looking much more full than I‚Äôve seen in 5 years and I worry the traveller fly tipping in the field will be gone by morning....into Wootton brook.

UPDATE Temporary barriers not now needed at Stratford. Less rain than originally forecast. There are however a lot of #flood warnings and alerts across the #Midlands so please avoid walking in or driving through flood water. https://t.co/2dBNUmkX5W

tweets.text:
There was a lot of rain fall across Northamptonshire yesterday with many areas flooding as a result. 

Stay safe out there. 

There are many accounts you can follow for information on staying safe, weather warnings and Northants updates. 

We‚Äôve created a list below. 

 1/2

Filmed at 3.45pm today still pouring with rain & just hate to think how much more üí©is gushing into this Chalkstream didn‚Äôt bother reporting it as the EA will probably now be on holiday ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èwith proper enforcement this could have been stopped in July @EnvAgencyAnglia
@CllrWarrenWhyte @EnvAgencyAnglia @EnvAgency Interestingly my Alexa show device has been displaying a Buckingham flood warning for the last couple of days so I wonder where she gets her information?

#Floods Warnings in Thames catchment for Evenlode, Cherwell and Ray, all flow into the Thames. Expect to see flooding onto the #ThamesPath in the next few days. 

Avoid using the Thames Path if it is flooded - divert, don't drown! @RamblersGB @EnvAgencySE @ODS_doinggood https://t.co/W88Sc9w8Kv

@EmmaHowardBoyd @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK Why do we have to wait until 2021 for this? Clean river water should be the norm and a priority for @EnvAgency all along. That @EmmaHowardBoyd trumpets this says all you need to know about the terrible job her agency has done for the last decade

Flood warnings are now in place for River Aire, Don and Dutch River at East Cowick, West Cowick and Lidgate. Check if you‚Äôre at risk and what to do to prepare for a flood. https://t.co/xbA8xs7Upr https://t.co/gLW7M7vZ2C
